H0.text: DNA ligase seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H1.text: Reductase is the enzyme that seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H2.text: RNA ligase seals the gap between two DNA fragments.

H3.text: Enzymes seal the gap between two DNA fragments.

A4.text: DNA ligase facilitates the joining of DNA strands together by catalyzing the formation of a phosphodiester bond.

A5.text: The mechanism of DNA ligase is to form two covalent phosphodiester bonds between 3' hydroxyl ends of one nucleotide ('acceptor'), with the 5' phosphate end of another ('donor').
